snippet: Willian Barboza, 22, who was arrested after he mailed a profanity-laced letter with his payment for a traffic ticket in upstate New York, is suing over the right to free speech.
abstract: New York Civil Liberties Union and law firm Bergstein & Ullrich file lawsuit on behalf of Willian Barboza, who was arrested after he mailed a profanity-laced letter with his payment for a traffic ticket in upstate New York; NYCLU is arguing that episode is emblematic of broader issue--how law enforcement officials can use a state statute in ways that may violate a person's right to free speech.
lead_paragraph: Willian Barboza, 22, who was arrested after he mailed a profanity-laced letter with his payment for a traffic ticket in upstate New York, is suing over the right to free speech.

headline.main: Arrested After His Vulgar Response to Traffic Ticket, Man Files Suit
headline.print_headline: Arrested After His Vulgar Reply to Traffic Ticket, Man Files a Suit
